definitions: strong black coffee made by forcing steam through finely ground coffee beans
examples: She ordered a double espresso to start her morning meeting
The barista prepared the espresso with perfect golden crema on top

definitions: shared sense of enthusiasm, loyalty, and devotion among members of a group
examples: Military units cultivate esprit de corps through shared training experiences
The team's esprit was evident in their coordinated efforts during crisis

definitions: title of respect placed after a man's surname in formal correspondence
professional designation used by lawyers in some jurisdictions, especially in the United States
examples: The letter was addressed to John Smith, Esquire at his office
Please send the documents to Robert Johnson, Esquire for review
Attorney Sarah Williams, Esquire represented the plaintiff in court
The law firm's letterhead listed James Chen, Esquire as senior partner

definitions: short piece of writing on a particular subject expressing the author's viewpoint
literary work exploring ideas through personal reflection and analytical discussion
examples: Students submitted their essays on environmental policy before the deadline
The college application required a personal essay about overcoming challenges
Montaigne pioneered the essay as a literary form in the Renaissance
Her collection of essays explored themes of identity and belonging

definitions: person who writes essays, especially as a literary occupation or expertise
examples: The renowned essayist published her thoughts on modern society weekly
James Baldwin worked as both a novelist and an essayist

definitions: the intrinsic nature or indispensable quality that determines something's character
concentrated liquid extract containing the fundamental properties of a substance
examples: The essence of democracy lies in citizen participation and representation
She captured the essence of the argument in three concise points
Add vanilla essence to the cake batter for enhanced flavor
The perfume contained essence of rose and jasmine flowers

definitions: something absolutely necessary or extremely important for a particular purpose or situation
examples: Water and shelter are essentials for human survival in wilderness
The course covers all the essentials of computer programming basics

definitions: place of business or residence with its furnishings and staff
action of establishing something or being established on a permanent basis
group in society exercising power and influence over policy and taste
examples: The establishment serves excellent Italian cuisine seven days a week
Several retail establishments closed during the economic downturn
The establishment of the company required significant initial capital investment
Scientists celebrated the establishment of the new research facility
Young activists challenged the establishment with progressive policy proposals
The political establishment resisted changes to the traditional system

definitions: extensive area of land in the country with a large house
all the money and property someone leaves when they die
area of land developed for residential or industrial use
examples: The family's country estate included gardens, forests, and a lake
They toured the historic estate with its mansion and grounds
The lawyer managed the estate according to the deceased's will
Her estate was divided equally among her three children
The new housing estate will provide homes for 500 families
Industrial estates on the city outskirts house manufacturing facilities

definitions: respect and admiration felt or shown towards someone or something valued highly
examples: She held her mentor in high esteem throughout her career
The professor earned the esteem of colleagues through groundbreaking research

definitions: set of principles underlying the work of an artist or artistic movement
examples: The minimalist esthetic emphasizes simplicity and essential forms in design
Her photography reflects an esthetic rooted in natural light and composition

definitions: rough calculation or judgment of value, number, quantity, or extent of something
examples: The contractor provided an estimate for the kitchen renovation project
Initial estimates suggest the project will take six months to complete

definitions: judgment or opinion about the worth or value of someone or something
process of finding an approximate value or making a rough calculation
examples: In my estimation, she's the best candidate for the position
The company rose in public estimation after the charity initiative
Statistical estimation methods help predict population parameters from sample data
The estimation of project costs requires careful analysis of resources

definitions: person whose job involves calculating probable costs of work or projects
statistical function or rule for calculating an estimate of a given quantity
examples: The construction estimator reviewed blueprints to determine material costs accurately
Insurance estimators assessed the damage after the storm
The maximum likelihood estimator provides optimal parameter values for the model
Researchers used an unbiased estimator to analyze the population variance

definitions: state of being separated or alienated from someone previously close, causing hostility or indifference
examples: Years of estrangement from his brother ended with a reconciliation
The couple's estrangement began after repeated disagreements about finances

definitions: group of hormones promoting development and maintenance of female characteristics in the body
examples: Estrogen levels fluctuate during different phases of the menstrual cycle
The doctor prescribed estrogen replacement therapy for menopausal symptoms

definitions: partially enclosed coastal body of water where freshwater from rivers meets seawater
examples: The Thames estuary supports diverse wildlife including migratory birds and fish
Mangrove forests thrive in tropical estuaries around the world

definitions: seventh letter of the Greek alphabet
estimated time of arrival for a vehicle, shipment, or person
examples: The Greek letter eta represents the sound similar to long a
Students learned to write eta in their ancient Greek class
The flight's ETA is 3:30 PM according to the airline tracker
Please provide an ETA for the delivery truck's arrival

definitions: artist who practices etching, creating designs on metal plates using acid
examples: The etcher carefully applied acid-resistant ground to the copper plate
Rembrandt was both a renowned painter and a master etcher

definitions: print made from an etched plate showing artistic design or image
printmaking process using acid to cut into metal plate surface
examples: The museum displayed original etchings by Francisco Goya
She purchased a limited edition etching from the gallery
The artist demonstrated the etching technique to her students
Traditional etching requires careful handling of acids and metals

definitions: infinite or unending time without beginning or end
state of eternal existence believed to follow death in some religions
examples: The wait seemed like an eternity though only minutes had passed
Philosophers debate whether eternity exists outside human perception
Many religions promise believers an eternity in paradise after death
She pondered questions about eternity and the meaning of existence

definitions: colorless volatile flammable liquid alcohol used as fuel, solvent, and in beverages
examples: The laboratory stored ethanol in sealed containers for experimental use
Many vehicles can run on gasoline blended with ethanol fuel

definitions: volatile liquid formerly used as an anesthetic and solvent
hypothetical substance once believed to fill space and transmit electromagnetic waves
organic compound with oxygen atom connected to two alkyl groups
examples: Doctors used ether as an anesthetic before modern alternatives existed
The sweet smell of ether filled the old operating room
Scientists disproved the existence of luminiferous ether in the nineteenth century
The concept of ether as a cosmic medium influenced early physics
Diethyl ether serves as a common solvent in organic chemistry laboratories
The chemist synthesized a new ether compound for the experiment

definitions: system for connecting computers and devices in a local area network using cables
examples: The office ethernet connection provides faster speeds than wireless networking
Plug the ethernet cable into your computer for internet access

definitions: moral principle that governs behavior or conducting of an activity
belief in the moral value and importance of work
examples: Professional ethics guide doctors in making difficult medical decisions
The company's ethic emphasizes transparency and customer service
Her strong work ethic impressed supervisors and earned quick promotion
The team's ethic of continuous improvement drove innovation

definitions: person belonging to a group sharing cultural tradition, language, or national origin
examples: The city celebrates its diverse ethnic communities through annual festivals
Various ethnic groups contributed to the neighborhood's rich cultural heritage

definitions: state of belonging to a social group with common cultural tradition or origin
examples: Census forms collect data about residents' ethnicity and racial background
Her ethnicity influenced her perspective on social justice issues

definitions: person who studies and describes the culture of peoples and societies scientifically
examples: The ethnographer lived with the indigenous community for two years
Urban ethnographers document rapidly changing neighborhood cultures

definitions: scientific description of peoples and cultures through systematic observation and participation
examples: Her ethnography of street vendors revealed complex social networks
Digital ethnography examines online communities and virtual cultures

definitions: customary code of polite behavior in society or among members of a profession
examples: Business etiquette varies significantly between different international cultures
The wedding planner explained proper etiquette for the formal ceremony

definitions: short musical composition designed to provide practice in a particular technical skill
examples: The pianist practiced Chopin's etudes to improve her finger technique
Each etude in the collection focuses on different technical challenges

definitions: study of the origin and historical development of words and their meanings
examples: The dictionary included detailed etymology for each entry
Students traced the etymology of English words from Latin roots

definitions: evergreen tree native to Australia, having aromatic leaves and valued for timber and oil
examples: Koalas feed exclusively on certain species of eucalypt leaves
The eucalypt forest recovered quickly after the controlled burn

definitions: speech or piece of writing praising someone highly, typically delivered at a funeral
examples: Her daughter delivered a moving eulogy at the memorial service
The eulogy celebrated his contributions to medical research

definitions: man who has been castrated, especially one employed to guard women in historical contexts
examples: Eunuchs served as trusted officials in ancient Chinese imperial courts
The Ottoman Empire employed eunuchs to guard the sultan's harem

definitions: mild or indirect word substituted for one considered too harsh or direct
examples: The phrase 'passed away' is a common euphemism for died
Political speeches often use euphemisms to soften controversial topics

definitions: large brass wind instrument with valves, producing a mellow tone similar to a tuba
examples: The euphonium player performed a solo during the brass band concert
He switched from trumpet to euphonium in the school orchestra

definitions: feeling or state of intense excitement, happiness, and well-being
examples: The team experienced euphoria after winning the championship game
The medication can cause temporary euphoria as a side effect

definitions: official currency used by most countries in the European Union
examples: The price converted to approximately fifty euros at current exchange rates
She exchanged dollars for euros before traveling to France

definitions: practice of intentionally ending life to relieve suffering, especially in medical contexts
examples: The ethics committee debated euthanasia policies for terminally ill patients
Several countries have legalized euthanasia under strict medical guidelines

definitions: organized removal of people from a dangerous place to safety
examples: The hurricane prompted mandatory evacuation of coastal residents
Fire drills practice evacuation procedures for building occupants

definitions: systematic determination of merit, worth, or significance through careful analysis
examples: Annual performance evaluations determine employee bonuses and promotions
The program evaluation revealed areas needing significant improvement

definitions: person who judges or determines the value, quality, or importance of something
examples: The external evaluator reviewed the school's academic programs objectively
Grant evaluators scored proposals based on established criteria

definitions: quality of being fleeting or rapidly fading from sight, memory, or existence
examples: The evanescence of morning mist created an ethereal landscape
Poets often contemplate the evanescence of youth and beauty

definitions: Protestant Christian movement emphasizing personal conversion, biblical authority, and spreading the gospel
examples: American evangelicalism significantly influences political and social discourse
The conference explored evangelicalism's growth in Latin American countries

definitions: zealous preaching and dissemination of the gospel to convert others to Christianity
examples: The church emphasized evangelism through community outreach programs
Digital evangelism uses social media to spread religious messages

definitions: person who seeks to convert others to Christianity through preaching
person who enthusiastically advocates for a particular cause or belief
examples: The evangelist traveled across rural communities preaching to large crowds
Television evangelists broadcast sermons to millions of viewers
She became an evangelist for sustainable living after environmental training
Tech evangelists promote new technologies at industry conferences

definitions: process by which liquid changes to vapor, especially through heat application
examples: Evaporation from ocean surfaces drives the global water cycle
The puddle disappeared through evaporation in the afternoon sun

definitions: action of escaping or avoiding something, especially through cunning or deception
examples: Tax evasion carries severe penalties including fines and imprisonment
His evasion of direct questions frustrated the interview panel

definitions: day or period immediately before an event or occasion
evening or day before a religious festival or holiday
examples: Tension mounted on the eve of the championship match
The company announced layoffs on the eve of quarterly earnings
Families gathered on Christmas Eve for traditional celebrations
New Year's Eve parties continued past midnight
